course.subject: MARK
course.name: Communications in the Digital Era
course.description: The course provides an introduction to the logic and dynamics of mass media communications, with an emphasis on deconstructing the impact of traditional and emerging media on society and on marketing practice. Special attention is devoted to the digital revolution in challenging and transforming the principles and practices of mass media communication.

reviews.author: bdl
reviews.comment_content: Quite interesting. Unlike other marketing courses, MARK1330 talks about how companies can use the  Internet to effectively promote their business, for example, using search engine optimization (SEO). Recommend students who are interested in the digital world to take the course.

reviews.author: Ekkachai
reviews.title: Easy but not good grade (not bad either)
reviews.comment_content: Provides an overview of Marketing fundamental concept, but not only digital marketing. Most of the topics and slides are interesting and related to our media world, yet some of them are duplicated. Prof will also invite guest speakers to class to give us a talk on different topics.
reviews.comment_grading: For Mid-term exam, I got the highest score. And for the the Digital Contest project, we got the highest score too. However, since we only got a mean score for the 1st project and final project, I could only get a B+ for this course. Your project performances can totally affect your grade, so its grade actually highly depends on your group projects and selected topic. Another point is that there are marketing major year 3 or even year 4 students in this class, which might be unfair to year 1 or 2 students.
reviews.comment_workload:
No final exam.
No assignments.
3 projects in total. The workload really depends on your group mates. Workload would not be heavy if they were supportive and were willing to contribute and cooperate.
(Final project actually = Final exam)

reviews.author: SVM
reviews.title: Brilliant
reviews.comment_content: Really informative and easy to understand. The best part of this course's content is that it feels practical and something which will actually be useful in a person's career.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Dennis Tan Lim is one of the best professors in HKUST, hands down. Very very highly recommended, not just for this course, but any course that he teaches.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grading. You do reasonably well, you'll get the grades.
reviews.comment_workload: There are group assignments. You should try and ensure that you get into a good group, where everyone does their job. Other than that, not much workload.
